sandra.examples.tts.ttswithintent
Class TTSWithIntent

java.lang.Object
  android.content.Context
      android.content.ContextWrapper
          android.view.ContextThemeWrapper
              android.app.Activity
                  sandra.examples.tts.ttswithintent.TTSWithIntent
All Implemented Interfaces:
android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.ComponentCallbacks2, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory2, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, android.view.Window.Callback
public class TTSWithIntent
extends android.app.Activity

TTSBegin: Basic app with text to speech synthesis Simple demo in which the user writes a text in a text field and it is synthesized by the system when pressing a button. The code for this app is self-contained: it uses an Intent for text to speech synthesis. The rest of the apps in the book employ a special TTS library (TTSLib).

Version:
1.2, 07/17/13
Author:
Zoraida Callejas, Michael McTear
See Also:
TTSDemo for the equivalent app using the TTSLib library

Method Summary
private  void disableSpeakButton()
          Disables the speak button so that the user cannot click it while a message is being synthesized
private  void enableSpeakButton()
          Enables the speak button so that the user can click on it to hear the synthesized message
private  void initTTS()
          Initializes the text to speech engine
protected  void onActivityResult(int requestCode, int resultCode, android.content.Intent data)
          Callback from check for text to speech engine installed If positive, then creates a new TextToSpeech instance which will be called when user clicks on the 'Speak' button If negative, creates an intent to install a TextToSpeech engine
protected  void onCreate(android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
          Sets up the activity initializing the text to speech engine
 void onDestroy()
          Shuts down the TTS when finished
private  void setButton()
          Sets up the listener for the button that the user must click to hear the obtained the synthesized message
